page.title: 12BRIMSMORE HOUSE
page.content: Brimsmore is on the outskirts of Yeovil.The occupants have lived there eighteen yrs. and own eight acres of land used for vegetable gardening. The principle garden is adorned with a large lawn on the periphery of which are bushes and flowers. Brimsmore is built of hamstone,quarried locally & well aged. The house is further made beautiful by climbers on its walls. The slated roof and window frames are not original. Aside the westerly wall is a porch.The house has eleven rooms: four bedrooms,dining room,kitchens and service quarters. Opposite is Johnson Park sports centre. Adjacent to the house is an antique shop.
